E.g., >> python transform.py -c configs/common_qa_config.json -i ./path/to/input/file/input_data_file.xlsx
(Optional) Enter sheet name to process from input Excel file. Default is the first sheet.
(Optional) Decide if pandas should interpret 'NA', 'N/A', 'NULL', etc. to NaN value. Default is false
(Optional) Boolean flag telling if we should write data to a destination place. Default is always True.
(Optional) Relative path (from folder in which transform.py resides) and file name of DataWriter class that has write_data method implemented.
Default is DataWriter class (implemented in 'csv_data_writer.py') which writes transformed data to local file in CSV format.
This option is only for those who wants to write data to somewhere other than to a local file in CSV format.

(Optional) Relative path of output folder if the data is going to be written to a file. Default is going to be the current working directory of transform.py
Default is going to be the current working directory of transform.py
(Optional) Prefix for the output file name.
(Optional although recommended) SQL table name to which the transformed data should be written.
Default name is 'default_transformed_sql_table_name' as defined in transform_utils.py
(Required ONLY IF MSSQLDriver class is used) Database schema to use if we write transformed data to SQL table.
(Optional) Whether to include index column in writing the dataframe to output file or table. Default is false.
(Optional) Path+name of that has **CUSTOM** functions for data transformation, which will be imported and used in the transform process.
